pylie

  • pylie

pylie¶

An instantiation-free python library for common matrix Lie group operations. Functions in this repo operate entirely on numpy arrays, with the intention of minimizing overhead and keeping the implementation as simple as possible.

Example¶

from pylie import SE2
import numpy as np

# Random pose
T = SE2.random()

# R^n to group directly (using "Capital" notation)
x = np.array([0.1, 2, 3])
T = SE2.Exp(x)

# Group to R^n directly
x = SE2.Log(T)

# Wedge, vee
Xi = SE2.wedge(x)
x = SE2.vee(Xi)

# Actual exp/log maps
T = SE2.exp(Xi)
Xi = SE2.log(T)

# Adjoint representation of group element
A = SE2.adjoint(T)

# Group left/right jacobians
J_L = SE2.left_jacobian(x)
J_R = SE2.right_jacobian(x)
J_L_inv = SE2.left_jacobian_inv(x)
J_R_inv = SE2.right_jacobian_inv(x)

API¶

class pylie.SO2¶

An instantiation-free implementation of the SO2 matrix Lie group.

classmethod Exp(x)¶

Shortcut method: R^n to group directly.

classmethod Log(X)¶

Shortcut method: group to R^n directly.

static adjoint(C)¶

Adjoint representation of group element.

static adjoint_algebra(Xi)¶

Adjoint representation of algebra element.

dof = 1¶
static exp(Xi)¶

Exponential map from algebra to group.

classmethod identity()¶

Returns an identity matrix of the group.

static inverse(X)¶

Group inverse.

static left_jacobian(phi)¶

Group left jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static left_jacobian_inv(phi)¶

Inverse of group left jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static log(X)¶

Logarithmic map from algebra to group.

static normalize(X)¶

Eliminates rounding errors: ensures matrix is proper group element.

static odot(b)¶

odot operator as defined in Barfoot. I.e., an operator on an element of R^n such that

a^wedge b = b^odot a

static random()¶

Return a random element of the group.

classmethod right_jacobian(x)¶

Group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

classmethod right_jacobian_inv(x)¶

Inverse of group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static vee(X)¶

Vee operator from algebra to R^n.

static wedge(phi)¶
Parameters

phi (float or numpy.ndarray) – Rotation vector, element of R^n.

class pylie.SE2¶

An instantiation-free implementation of the SE3 matrix Lie group.

classmethod Exp(x)¶

Shortcut method: R^n to group directly.

classmethod Log(X)¶

Shortcut method: group to R^n directly.

static adjoint(T)¶

Adjoint representation of group element.

static adjoint_algebra(Xi)¶

Adjoint representation of algebra element.

dof = 3¶
static exp(Xi)¶

Exponential map from algebra to group.

static from_components(C, r)¶

Construct an SE(2) matrix from a rotation matrix and translation vector.

classmethod identity()¶

Returns an identity matrix of the group.

static inverse(X)¶

Group inverse.

static left_jacobian(xi)¶

Group left jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

classmethod left_jacobian_inv(x)¶

Inverse of group left jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static log(T)¶

Logarithmic map from algebra to group.

static normalize(X)¶

Eliminates rounding errors: ensures matrix is proper group element.

static odot(b)¶

odot operator as defined in Barfoot. I.e., an operator on an element of R^n such that

a^wedge b = b^odot a

static random()¶

Return a random element of the group.

classmethod right_jacobian(x)¶

Group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

classmethod right_jacobian_inv(x)¶

Inverse of group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static to_components(T)¶

Decompose an SE(2) matrix into a rotation matrix and translation vector.

static vee(Xi)¶

Vee operator from algebra to R^n.

static wedge(xi)¶

Wedge operator from R^n to algebra.

class pylie.SO3¶

An instantiation-free implementation of the SO3 matrix Lie group.

classmethod Exp(x)¶

Shortcut method: R^n to group directly.

classmethod Log(X)¶

Shortcut method: group to R^n directly.

static adjoint(C)¶

Adjoint representation of group element.

static adjoint_algebra(Xi)¶

Adjoint representation of algebra element.

static cross(xi)¶
dof = 3¶
static exp(Xi)¶

Maps elements of the matrix Lie algebra so(3) to the group.

From Section 8.3 of Lie Groups for Computer Vision by Ethan Eade. When theta is small, use Taylor series expansion given in Section 11.

static from_euler(angles, order=[3, 2, 1])¶

Creates a DCM from a 3-element vector of euler angles with specified order.

Parameters

  • angles (list[float] or ndarray of size 3) – euler angle values

  • order (list[int], optional) – euler angle sequence. For example, the default order=[3,2,1] rotates the third axis, followed by the second, followed by the first.

Returns

DCM corresponding to euler angles

Return type

ndarray with shape (3,3)

static from_quat(q, order='wxyz')¶

Returns the DCM corresponding to the quaternion representation q.

Parameters

  • q (list[float] or ndarray of size 4) – quaternion

  • order (str, optional) – quaternion element order “xyzw” or “wxyz”, defaults to “wxyz”

Raises

  • ValueError – if q is not of size 4

  • ValueError – if order is not “xyzw” or “wxyz”

Returns

DCM corresponding to q

Return type

ndarray with shape (3,3)

classmethod identity()¶

Returns an identity matrix of the group.

static inverse(X)¶

Group inverse.

static left_jacobian(xi)¶

Computes the Left Jacobian of SO(3). From Section 9.3 of Lie Groups for Computer Vision by Ethan Eade. When angle is small, use Taylor series expansion given in Section 11.

static left_jacobian_inv(xi)¶

Computes the inverse of the left Jacobian of SO(3). From Section 9.3 of Lie Groups for Computer Vision by Ethan Eade. When angle is small, use Taylor series expansion given in Section 11.

static log(X)¶

Logarithmic map from algebra to group.

static normalize(X)¶

Eliminates rounding errors: ensures matrix is proper group element.

static odot(xi)¶

odot operator as defined in Barfoot. I.e., an operator on an element of R^n such that

a^wedge b = b^odot a

static random()¶

Return a random element of the group.

classmethod right_jacobian(x)¶

Group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

classmethod right_jacobian_inv(x)¶

Inverse of group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static to_euler(C)¶

Convert a rotation matrix to RPY Euler angles \((\alpha, \beta, \gamma)\) corresponding to a (3,2,1) Euler-angle sequence.

static to_quat(C, order='wxyz')¶

Returns the quaternion corresponding to DCM C.

Parameters

  • C (ndarray with shape (3,3)) – DCM/rotation matrix to convert.

  • order (str, optional) – quaternion element order “xyzw” or “wxyz”, defaults to “wxyz”

Raises

  • ValueError – if C does not have shape (3,3)

  • ValueError – if order is not “xyzw” or “wxyz”

Returns

quaternion representation of C

Return type

ndarray with shape (4,1)

static vee(X)¶

Vee operator from algebra to R^n.

static wedge(xi)¶

Wedge operator from R^n to algebra.

class pylie.SE3¶

An instantiation-free implementation of the SE3 matrix Lie group.

classmethod Exp(x)¶

Shortcut method: R^n to group directly.

classmethod Log(X)¶

Shortcut method: group to R^n directly.

static adjoint(T)¶

Adjoint representation of group element.

static adjoint_algebra(Xi)¶

Adjoint representation of algebra element.

dof = 6¶
static exp(Xi)¶

Exponential map from algebra to group.

static from_components(C, r)¶

Construct an SE(3) matrix from a rotation matrix and translation vector.

static from_ros(pose_msg)¶

Constructs an SE(3) matrix from a ROS Pose message.

Parameters

pose_msg (geometry_msgs/Pose) – pose message.

Returns

SE(3) pose transformation matrix.

Return type

ndarray with shape (4,4)

classmethod identity()¶

Returns an identity matrix of the group.

Group inverse.

a^wedge b = b^odot a

Return a random element of the group.

Deprecated. Use from_components()

Construct an SE(3) matrix from a rotation matrix and translation vector.

class pylie.SE23¶

An instantiation-free implementation of the SE_2(3) matrix Lie group.

classmethod Exp(x)¶

Shortcut method: R^n to group directly.

classmethod Log(X)¶

Shortcut method: group to R^n directly.

static adjoint(X)¶

Adjoint representation of group element.

static adjoint_algebra(Xi)¶

Adjoint representation of algebra element.

static decompose(element_SE23)¶

Deprecated. Use to_components().

Decompose an element of SE_2(3) into its constituent parts.

dof = 9¶
static exp(Xi)¶

Exponential map from algebra to group.

static from_components(C, v, r)¶

Construct an SE_2(3) matrix from rotation, velocity, position.

classmethod identity()¶

Returns an identity matrix of the group.

static inverse(X)¶

Group inverse.

static left_jacobian(x)¶

Group left jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

classmethod left_jacobian_inv(x)¶

Inverse of group left jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static log(X)¶

Logarithmic map from algebra to group.

static normalize(X)¶

Eliminates rounding errors: ensures matrix is proper group element.

static odot(b)¶

odot operator as defined in Barfoot. I.e., an operator on an element of R^n such that

a^wedge b = b^odot a

static random()¶

Return a random element of the group.

Group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

classmethod right_jacobian_inv(x)¶

Inverse of group right jacobian evaluated at x in R^n

static synthesize(C, v, r)¶

Deprecated. Use from_components().

Form an element of SE_2(3).

static to_components(X)¶

Extract rotation, velocity, position from SE_2(3) matrix.

static vee(Xi)¶

Vee operator from algebra to R^n.

Wedge operator from R^n to algebra.
